intro: Bystropogon × beltraniae, commonly known as the hybrid hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant features palmate leaves with a velvety texture and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical landscapes.
